did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Collection includes 44 original, hand-collaged past-up boards from which the IGTimes page layouts were reproduced; hundreds of original manuscript, typescript, and desktop printing documents comprising the text files from which its editorial content was drawn; more than 4000 original photographs of aerosol street art submitted to the magazine by a community of international aerosol writers and readers; ca. 5000 original reader submissions; ca. 500 original magazines and fanzines; 150 clippings from newspapers and magazines; the archive of the Aerosol Art Armada, which includes ca. 1,000 35 mm. slide transparencies; a selection of flyers for parties and openings in New York City; 5 file folders with information from scholarly researchers who contacted the IGTimes for information on street art.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: In late 1983, downtown artist and photographer David Schmidlapp published the first issue of the IGTimes under the name "Yanqui Junkie." The International Graffiti Times was "the original inner-city, international, aerosol 'zine,' and the Aerosol Art Armada traveling show, providing a view of the development of aerosol street art and the rise of hip hop culture in New York City and around the world from the 1970s to the 1990s.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Collection includes 44 original, hand-collaged past-up boards from which the IGTimes page layouts were reproduced; hundreds of original manuscript, typescript, and desktop printing documents comprising the text files from which its editorial content was drawn; more than 4000 original photographs of aerosol street art submitted to the magazine by a community of international aerosol writers and readers; ca. 5000 original reader submissions; ca. 500 original magazines and fanzines; 150 clippings from newspapers and magazines; the archive of the Aerosol Art Armada, which includes ca. 1,000 35 mm. slide transparencies; a selection of flyers for parties and openings in New York City; 5 file folders with information from scholarly researchers who contacted the IGTimes for information on street art.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: International Graffiti Times Archive, #8067. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

scopecontent.p: Includes Rock and Roll, Bronx Museum, NY Press, John Nation, and New Museum.

Contains original photographs of aerosol street art, many submitted to the magazine by a community of international âaerosolâ writers and other readers, others shot by Schmidlapp and the magazineâs inner circle and a few from professional photographers documenting the various scenes.
Many folders also contain flyers and correspondence.

Consists of manuscripts, typescript and desktop printing documents comprising the core of the magazineâs editorial content for each of the 15 issues, including interview transcripts and notes for articles.

did.unittitle: Xeroxes of press clips and covers of press

A selection of fliers for parties, openings, and events in New York City featuring the magazine itself and members of the IGTimes community, including correspondence with alternative art spaces ABC no Rio, Fashion Moda Gallery, Franklin Furnace and Food Stamp Gallery, ca. 1984-1994.
Flyers, clippings, and sections from zines

scopecontent.p: Includes Writer's Resource Guide, War Craft, New Urbanism, CafÃ© Armageddon, 14k, Bullshit Monthly

Consists mainly of reader submissions including letters, postcards, original artwork, photographs and other items from local and international correspondents, as well as mail art, prisoner and G.I. letters, and subscription requests
